org.resthub.web.controller

Interface RestController<T,ID extends Serializable>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Your resource POJO to manage, maybe an entity or DTO class
    ID - Primary resource identifier at webservice level, usually Long or String
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RepositoryBasedRestController, ServiceBasedRestController

    public interface RestController<T,ID extends Serializable>
    REST controller interface

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T create(T resource)
      Create a new resource
      REST webservice published : POST /
      void delete()
      Delete all resources
      REST webservice published : DELETE /
      Return No Content http status code if the request has been correctly processed

      Delete a resource by its identifier
      REST webservice published : DELETE /{id}
      Return No Content http status code if the request has been correctly processed

      Find all resources, and return a paginated and optionaly sorted collection
      REST webservice published : GET /search?
      T update(ID id, T resource)
      Update an existing resource
      REST webservice published : PUT /{id}

    • Method Detail

      • create

        @RequestMapping(method=POST)
@ResponseStatus(value=CREATED)
@ResponseBody
T create(@RequestBody
                                                  T resource)
        Create a new resource
        REST webservice published : POST /
        Parameters:
        resource - The resource to create
        Returns:
        CREATED http status code if the request has been correctly processed, with updated resource enclosed in the body, usually with and additional identifier automatically created by the database

      • update

        @RequestMapping(value="{id}",
                method=PUT)
@ResponseBody
T update(@PathVariable
                                   ID id,
                                   @RequestBody
                                   T resource)
        Update an existing resource
        REST webservice published : PUT /{id}
        Parameters:
        id - The identifier of the resource to update, usually a Long or String identifier. It is explicitely provided in order to handle cases where the identifier could be changed.
        resource - The resource to update
        Returns:
        OK http status code if the request has been correctly processed, with the updated resource enclosed in the body
        Throws:
        NotFoundException

      • findAll

        @RequestMapping(method=GET,
                params="page=no")
@ResponseBody
Iterable<T> findAll()
        Find all resources, and return the full collection (plain list not paginated)
        REST webservice published : GET /?page=no
        Returns:
        OK http status code if the request has been correctly processed, with the list of all resource enclosed in the body. Be careful, this list should be big since it will return ALL resources. In this case, consider using paginated findAll method instead.

      • findPaginated

        @RequestMapping(method=GET)
@ResponseBody
org.springframework.data.domain.Page<T> findPaginated(@RequestParam(value="page",required=false,defaultValue="1")
                                                                                Integer page,
                                                                                @RequestParam(value="size",required=false,defaultValue="10")
                                                                                Integer size,
                                                                                @RequestParam(value="direction",required=false,defaultValue="ASC")
                                                                                String direction,
                                                                                @RequestParam(value="properties",required=false)
                                                                                String properties)
        Find all resources, and return a paginated and optionaly sorted collection
        REST webservice published : GET /search?page=0&size=20 or GET /search?page=0&size=20&direction=desc&properties=name
        Parameters:
        page - Page number starting from 0. default to 0
        size - Number of resources by pages. default to 10
        direction - Optional sort direction, could be "asc" or "desc"
        properties - Ordered list of comma separeted properies used for sorting resulats. At least one property should be provided if direction is specified
        Returns:
        OK http status code if the request has been correctly processed, with the a paginated collection of all resource enclosed in the body.

      • findById

        @RequestMapping(value="{id}",
                method=GET)
@ResponseBody
T findById(@PathVariable
                                     ID id)
        Find a resource by its identifier
        REST webservice published : GET /{id}
        Parameters:
        id - The identifier of the resouce to find
        Returns:
        OK http status code if the request has been correctly processed, with resource found enclosed in the body
        Throws:
        NotFoundException

      • findByIds

        @RequestMapping(method=GET,
                params="ids[]")
@ResponseBody
Iterable<T> findByIds(@RequestParam(value="ids[]")
                                                Set<ID> ids)
        Find multiple resources by their identifiers
        REST webservice published : GET /?ids[]=

        example : /?ids[]=1&ids[]=2&ids[]=3

        Parameters:
        ids - List of ids to retrieve
        Returns:
        OK http status code with list of retrieved resources. Not found resources are ignored: no Exception thrown. List is empty if no resource found with any of the given ids.

      • delete

        @RequestMapping(method=DELETE)
@ResponseStatus(value=NO_CONTENT)
void delete()
        Delete all resources
        REST webservice published : DELETE /
        Return No Content http status code if the request has been correctly processed

      • delete

        @RequestMapping(value="{id}",
                method=DELETE)
@ResponseStatus(value=NO_CONTENT)
void delete(@PathVariable
                                        ID id)
        Delete a resource by its identifier
        REST webservice published : DELETE /{id}
        Return No Content http status code if the request has been correctly processed
        Parameters:
        id - The identifier of the resource to delete
        Throws:
        NotFoundException
